name: Courtney Wilson
text: Excellent service; social, friendly atmosphere; knowledgeable; diverse one of a kind selection; a yarn enthusiasts dream store!

name: Stephanie Halkias
text: Amazing store with wide selection. Owner was engaging and great to talk to, and met some of her students and friends as well. Loved the place. Wish I lived close enough to hang out!

name: Anna Neese
text: Best yarn shop ever! Nina is the most knowledgeable person you will find in the fiber arts. Not only that, she is so helpful. I would not have the confidence I do in knitting if I didn’t have Nina helping me find the right yarns... correct needle... gage.. etc. whatever you need, this shop has it and you truly will not find better costumer service. This shop brings a whole different meaning to “knitting community.” Could not recommend more.

name: Sharon Carpenter
text: I wish I knew that this shop existed sooner! Nina is passionate about her work and generous enough to donate her time and stock to help the community learn the intricacies of yarnwork. The shop was decorated beautifully and systematically, and I wish I had more time to look around. I will definitely be going back soon to shop for my next project!

name: Nancy Morris
text: Great yarns and fibers, lots of help, and lots of inspiration.  Be aware that hours may vary because of COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Tammy Chappel
text: I love this yarn shop. Nina and her staff are always very helpful in picking out colors for my projects. ☺️

name: Kathy Schele
text: Very friendly and helpful! Will enjoy visiting again!

name: Robyn Griffin
text: I have never been so offended and disappointed in a business, ever. I was in this shop today and was told, by the owner (with a look of disgust on her face) that simply because I Loom Knit my work is not art. I put the same energy and heart into my projects just as you, Shame on You! This is definitely not your friendly yarn shop - well not if your a Loomer anyway.

name: Jane Stull
text: Fabulous yarn shop! I have a great time every time I shop!

name: Julia Rose Vallely
text: My name is Julia and Mrs. Nina is the nicest person on earth! When I first started knitting I walked in and told her the funny story of how I taught myself on barbecue skewers and how I had finally convinced my mom that really wanted to learn to knit! Her shop is the first place I got to use real knitting needles and high quality yarn! Her prices are great and she has something for all price ranges. Her shop makes you feel so at home and smells amazing! She is a lovely person and is so incredibly nice. I recommend her shop a million times over!

resp.text: Thank you so much .  I am so happy you knit.

name: Briana Garrison
text: Great shop to get really awesome and soft and squishy yarn!

name: Sherry French
text: A lovely shop! Bigger on the inside than you would expect. They have everything you could need and such great employees/volunteers. The owner was at a conference when I went in, but I will be back. More than once, I am sure. Go visit!

name: Cat B
text: I have been a customer for over a year.  The owner and other employees/volunteers/customers are awesome.  Very knowledgeable, helpful and enthusiastic.  Great LYS!  Emphasis on knitting, but completely welcoming to other fiber arts.

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming!!!

name: Robin O.
text: The shop owner was very helpful when I came in as a beginner knitter.  She gave me a tour of the shop and answered all of my questions.  I have been coming back for over a year now, and I still am in love with the shop.  There is a great selection of quality yarn and notions, and stitch night is also very fun.  I would recommend this yarn shop to anyone who enjoys knitting and crocheting and is looking for a warm atmosphere.

name: Kelley Vann Johns
text: I love this shop! What a great selection of yarns and tools, and super-friendly people!

name: Debbie Kanzelmeyer
text: I drive over from Atlanta to visit this yarn shop.  I'm always impressed with the yarn choices and quality of yarn as well as the customer service and the friendly environment.  I consider Fiber Art Work my LYS even if I have to drive over 4 hours to get there.  Thank you, Nina, for such an amazing shop.

resp.text: Thank you so much . I love when you visit

name: Patrice Wassmann
text: I'm so happy to have found this gem of a store on my cross country trip!! Super friendly owner & customers & exquisite yarns!! Will be back every time I'm in Huntsville for sure! If you are looking for cheap acrylic yarn this is not the place for you, but if you want the best high quality yarns for your projects you will find it here!!

name: Kitty Bryan
text: Always a welcoming place.  Nina is an excellent teacher and will guide you in the right direction.

name: Elizabeth Good
text: Wonderful small business!  Knowledgeable owner with a wonderful helping spirit.  This is the best place in Huntsville to go to for high quality natural fibers for needle work.

name: Brad McClellan
text: Knowledgeable friendly staff and it seems to have a community attached. Lots of yarn selection. Weaving and crochet things are included, but a slightly greater emphasis on knitting.

name: Shelley Parker
text: I love this store. Very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable owner. Wonderful selection of yarn. A nice lys and one of my favorite stops when I am in Huntsville.

name: P M
text: Owner very helpful with a comfortable, friendly environment!  Have been to many shops but this one is by far the best and the main reason is the welcoming atmosphere.  My go-to for all supplies.

name: Mrs. Darling
text: So glad to find this lil yarn shop! The owner was very nice and helpful. Even her regular customers were helpful. Comfortable atmosphere with a very nice selection of good quality yarn.

name: Martha Rickard
text: Loved visiting this quant store. Beautiful selection and wonderful service. Has a nice place to knit or crochet. Will defiantly return.

name: Cornbread Oracle
text: This is a fabulous shop. This store is all about the yarn. She has terrific inventory. Something for any knitter, crocheter, spinner or weaver.

name: Amy Mooney
text: What a wonderful store! Such friendly service greeted me and answered all my questions.

resp.text: Thank you so much for coming . Glad you enjoyed the yarn

name: denmark
text: Friendly and helpful owner; I was just passing through town and happened upon this LYS. Lovely yarn and a variety of accessories!

name: Genie Bryan
text: A beautiful shop where only the people are more beautiful than the yarn. Go there. Really.

name: S. Reeves
text: Great yarns at good prices, a friendly atmosphere, and a knowledgeable staff.

name: Kirby Tucker
text: Great local yarn shop!

name: Diana Courter
text: Finally, a local place for weaving supplies. I'm elated.

name: Haley D
text: Love the selection of yarn

name: Spirit Walker Adventures
text: This is such a gem of a yarn shop! I am so happy that I got to stop here and get some goodies on our trip before we headed back home. The owner was so nice and friendly! I got some knitting things I had never seen before in other shops. This is a must when I return to Gadsen again! I love everything about this shop! Thank you for this wonderful place!

name: Kat
text: Great yarn and tea shop.  Very customer friendly.  They have tables set up and you can bring your projects to get free help.  Free lessons.  Just browsing today.  Can't wait to come back.  Takes all the fear out of trying.

name: Dustin Martin
text: Absolutely fantastic shop. The owners are friendly and very knowledgeable. They make you feel comfortable and welcome. Tons of different types of yarn and an absolutely stunning variety of teas and honey. Well worth a visit. 5 stars because they won't let me give 6.

name: Donna Underwood
text: I love this yarn shop. If Pat doesn't have in stock what I need, she orders and gets it to me quickly. The expertise of the owner and employees in all things knitting helped me learn to knit. Friendly, cozy atmosphere along with the tea samples increases the welcoming feeling.

name: Bonnie Taylor
text: My favorite place. Love them all.

name: Melanie Nixon
text: Such a great little shop filled with so many different flavors of teas and such friend and helpful people working there!

name: Michelle Wood-Capolino
text: Excellent. Friendly atmosphere,  good service, helpful staff.

name: Amy Sight
text: This place has a very pleasant environment and an exceptional selection of teas and yarn! They also will help you with a knitting/crocheting project for free! Very friendly as well! I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Pam Hill
text: Loved it.

name: Stephanie Pearce
text: Wonderful shop run by wonderful people!

name: Betty Boone
text: This is the best place for beginners, experts and everything in between!  I've crocheted and knitted since my grandmother's knee but was never very good because I couldn't do it "her way".  These ladies have sgown me that my way is just fine and to simple enjoy.   Since Christmas,  I have crocheted a baby blanket, started another and am now trying knitting.  All because of this wonderful little gem!

name: Sydney Tinney
text: Miss Pat and the lovely ladies here are amazing! They took the time today to show me the basics of knitting & introduce me to a new love.

resp.text: We're all very glad you came in. We hope to see a lot more of you

name: Amy Roe
text: Wonderful selection of teas. I got Blueberry and make it with honey. This coming from a non tea drinker.

name: Rebecca Weber
text: I enjoy going to Taming of the Ewe so much...great peaceful atmosphere, great selection of yarns, etc...Pat and Detta are such very good teachers...and patient and kind...you will be so glad you came...

name: Kelly E
text: Went in during Christmas to pick up some things for crafts. Super, and I mean super nice ladies there. Sorry to see it close soon.

resp.text: We aren't closed just moved across the street

name: Angela Whorton
text: Great yarn and teas.

name: Pamela Knott hill Yarn4life
text: Would live there

name: Jessica Pate
text: Beautiful yarn! Wonderful people!
